title: Ticket #5210: condor_kbdd should not report transient mouse movement as 'activity'
description:
It is complicated to write a policy for HTCondor that pays attention to deliberate mouse/keyboard activity but ignores unintended activity. The use of a SUSPEND policy is an attempt to deal with that, by suspending a job at the first sign of keyboard/mouse, and then evicting it only when the keyboard activity proves to be sustained.

It would be much simpler if the keyboard daemon simply did not report transient activity at all. In particular it could ignore mouse movement that was not sustained over a configurable number milliseconds - but treat any keyboard activity as proof that a user was present.

This would allow us to ignore the issue of transients when writing the startd policy.
remarks:
2015-Aug-13 11:56:01 by johnkn:
two new config knobs control the sensitivity of this feature

  • KBDD_BUMP_CHECK_SIZE number of pixels that the mouse can move in x and/or y while still being considered a 'bump'. i.e. if the movement is greater than this value then the move is not a transient and will register as activity. default is 16 pixels. setting this to 0 effectively disables bump testing.

  • KBDD_BUMP_CHECK_AFTER_IDLE_TIME number of seconds of idle time before bump testing begins. default is 15 minutes.

The algorithm is that after a period of idle time, if mouse movement is detected, and the mouse movement is less than KBDD_BUMP_CHECK_SIZE, then a second test is made for mouse movement after a 1 second pause. if the mouse is still moving, then the movement is reported as activity. if the mouse has not moved again, then the movement is ignored.
